Public transport shouldn't be opened at the expense of health security --MMDA exec tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-738660 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/738660/public-transport-shouldn-t-be-opened-at-the-expense-of-health-security-mmda-exec/story/ An official of the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority (MMDA) on Monday said health security should not be compromised just to open public transport services for workers returning to their jobs. Mon, 18 May 2020 13:14:05 +0800

Mon, 18 May 2020 13:00:17 +0800

Mon, 18 May 2020 12:58:14 +0800
COVID-19 test for returning workers crucial to prevent second wave, says Hontiveros tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-738656 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/738656/covid-19-test-for-returning-workers-crucial-to-prevent-second-wave-says-hontiveros/story/ Employees who would return to work amid the relaxed restrictions must undergo COVID-19 tests, Senator Risa Hontiveros reiterated on Monday, after the Department of Labor and Employment said that such test is not mandatory. Mon, 18 May 2020 12:28:32 +0800
CBCP scraps 'abays' during wedding, issues guidelines for other liturgical celebrations under new normal tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-738655 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/738655/cbcp-scraps-abays-during-wedding-issues-guidelines-for-other-liturgical-celebrations-under-new-normal/story/ The Catholic Bishops' Conference of the Philippines (CBCP) has issued guidelines for liturgical celebrations in anticipation of the return of church ceremonies in light of the new normal due to coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). Mon, 18 May 2020 12:28:00 +0800
Public transport to be required to record passenger contact details once operations resume -- LTFRB tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-738654 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/738654/public-transport-to-be-required-to-record-passenger-contact-details-once-operations-resume-ltfrb/story/ "Kailangang may manifesto ng pasahero kasama 'yung mga pangalan, contact number on the part of the bus operator... Hindi lang sa bus 'yan, kundi sa lahat ng public transport system -- jeep, taxi, lahat," LTFRB chairman Martin Delgra said during the Laging Handa public briefing on Monday."On the part of the passenger, we are requesting to them and appealing to them na kung puwedeng isulat 'yung sasakyan," said Delgra. Mon, 18 May 2020 12:23:48 +0800
DTI Sec. Lopez denies malls were filled with people over the weekend tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-738652 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/738652/dti-sec-lopez-denies-malls-were-filled-with-people-over-the-weekend/story/ Trade Secretary Ramon Lopez on Monday denied that malls and other retail establishments teemed with people when their operations partially resumed over the weekend amid the easing of quarantine restrictions in Metro Manila and other areas. Mon, 18 May 2020 11:53:13 +0800

Mon, 18 May 2020 11:51:08 +0800
De Lima slams crackdown on Duterte's online critics: 'Bawal ang balat-sibuyas sa gobyerno' tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-738651 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/738651/de-lima-slams-crackdown-on-duterte-s-online-critics-bawal-ang-balat-sibuyas-sa-gobyerno/story/ "I find it very disturbing that our law enforcement agencies - PNP, NBI, and even PSG - are training their guns on online Duterte critics. Kahit walang warrant, kahit walang asunto, arestado," Senator Leila de Lima said in a statement. Mon, 18 May 2020 11:51:06 +0800
Beaches, parks busy as Europe heat wave and US spring test new coronavirus rules tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-738646 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/world/738646/beaches-parks-busy-as-europe-heat-wave-and-us-spring-test-new-coronavirus-rules/story/ Summer weather is enticing much of the world to emerge from coronavirus lockdowns as centers of the outbreak from New York to Italy and Spain gradually lift restrictions that have kept millions indoors for months. Mon, 18 May 2020 11:41:21 +0800
ECOP: Gov t should shoulder testing of private employees tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-738647 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/738647/ecop-gov-t-should-shoulder-testing-of-private-employees/story/ "Hindi naman compulsary 'yun, kaya lang 'yung mga kompanya, if you want to be sure, you might as well do it... Kung hindi mo naman gagawin 'yung testing mo eh baka naman may magkasakit sa'yo eh hindi masyadong maliwanag kung hanggang saan ang responsibilidad mo," ECOP chairman Sergio Ortiz-Luis Jr. said in an interview on Dobol B sa News TV on Monday. Mon, 18 May 2020 11:38:31 +0800

Mon, 18 May 2020 11:29:16 +0800
